name: oncardid
body: |- wi(wcel(c0, con0), wbr(cfv(ccrd, c0), cen, c0))

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, con0), wbr(cfv(ccrd, c0), cen, c0), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, con0), wbr(cfv(ccrd, c0), cen, c0))
-| wi(wcel(c0, con0), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wbr(cfv(ccrd, c0), cen, c0))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ On →(card ` c0)[≅]c0)
⊣ (c0 ∈ On → c0 ∈ dom(card))
⊣ (c0 ∈ dom(card)→(card ` c0)[≅]c0)

-| wi(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wbr(cfv(ccrd, c0), cen, c0))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ On →(card ` c0)[≅]c0)
⊣ (c0 ∈ On → c0 ∈ dom(card))
⊣ (c0 ∈ dom(card)→(card ` c0)[≅]c0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, con0), wbr(cfv(ccrd, c0), cen, c0))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wbr(cfv(ccrd, c0), cen, c0))

body.origin: |- wi(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wbr(cfv(ccrd, c0), cen, c0))

cumulated.origin: |- wi(wcel(c0, con0), wbr(cfv(ccrd, c0), cen, c0))

comment: Any ordinal number is equinumerous to its cardinal number. Unlike ~ cardid , this theorem does not require the Axiom of Choice. (Contributed by NM, 26-Jul-2004.)
